content.en: Optimizing tolerances: Researchers are using algorithms to tackle the problem of allocating tolerances in engineering designs. Genetic algorithms are being employed to optimize the types and magnitudes of geometric tolerances, while a sequential quadratic programming algorithm embedded with a Monte Carlo simulation is used to incorporate robust tolerance design. These algorithms are helping to find the best balance between manufacturing cost, functional performance, and quality in the design process.
content.da: Optimering af tolerancer: Forskere bruger algoritmer til at tackle problemet med at tildele tolerancer i ingeniørdesigns. Genetiske algoritmer bliver anvendt til at optimere typerne og størrelsesordnerne af geometriske tolerancer, mens en sekventiel kvadratisk programmeringsalgoritme indlejret med en Monte Carlo-simulering bruges til at inkorporere robust tolerance design. Disse algoritmer hjælper med at finde den bedste balance mellem produktionsomkostninger, funktionel ydeevne og kvalitet i designprocessen.
